content.rendered:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Bachelor schedule

The curriculum is well structured and meets the basic requirements for quality work. Work programs are designed in accordance with developments in the European Higher Education Area (EHEA). The nature and specifics of these programs promises achievement in conformity with labor market needs. Programs for each subject have their basic structure together with goals, objectives, methodology, content, assessment and literature.

Studies are regular and part time without parting from work.

 

Master schedules

The first two semesters (VII and VIII) include general vocational courses which represent the basis for mastering of professional disciplines in transport. Ninth semester (IX) includes relevant professional courses depending on the specialization. Tenth semester (X) includes application of the experience (internship) respectively professional practice and in the end the research work is presented in the form of a special project by which the student graduates. Studies can be enrolled as regularly and without partition from work.

 [/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image=”5126″ img_size=”full”][/vc_column][/vc_row]
